reviews.sentence: Wonderful. nice location and facilitiesswiming pool a bit small.

Great location. Nice views from the ocean view rooms. Hotel is in brand new condition but so are the services. Had to wait 45 minutes for our car at the valet and finally took an Uber to our destination. The coffee bar was seldomly staffed early in the morning.

Mixed. nice place customer service needs work. Went for a long weekend with kids ages 2 and 6. A very mixed experience. Excellent location nice facilities great pool if you do not mind relentless dance music. But customer service needs work. Sometimes excellent but when things went wrong we got excuses and BS not I am so sorry let me see what I can do for you. Arrived 130am and were told our room was not ready come back in 15 hr. No prob. At 2 pm we are told it will not be ready until 3. At 3 it was still not ready. We got irate. we had a toddler who was up at 5 am for a flight and desperately needed a nap. We repeated we had originally been told 15hr agent response was I do not know I was not there. Asked to speak to a manager who got us a room. When our kids french toast was took a long time at breakfast a waiter said That usually takes 35 minutes. I told him it had not taken that long the day before. 35 minutes for french toast. Other minor things we set the room thermostat to 75 deg but AC would not shut off and we kept windows open to be warm enough. Rrestaurant had only 3 high chairs though there were 4 or 5 families with toddlers staying there. Bottom line. This hotel could be a great place when they get the kinks worked out in customer service. Meanwhile be prepared to weather a few problems esp. if you have young kids.

I have been travelling to South Beach for 16 years and through experience have narrowed my list of preferred hotels down to two. However I only had the opportunity to stay for one night this week and did not feel like paying 500 or more a night for a room I would spend little time in. That being said I did not want to trade off in rate for a lesser experience. Nautilus is advertising opening rates as they opened just 4 months ago. I took a chance and was extremely glad I did. The hotel is in a great location on the beach on Collins near Lincoln Road mall and not too far of a walk to the restaurants on Ocean. The hotel is not pretentious and does not try to hard to be hip. The vibe is just right. The lobby is a nice wide open space with a sunken bar and the onsite restaurant was very good although not crowded. I really enjoyed my experience at the pool. There were plenty of chairs and it seems the staff does a really good job cleaning up empty chairs discouraging the type of people that try and save chairs. Now on to the room. I stayed in a King Superior and it was nice and roomy and did not feel at all cramped like many other art deco restored hotels. The bathroom is on the small side but I had rather have a smaller bathroom and bigger room. The bed was firm and unbelievably comfortable. I really look forward to visiting the Nautilus when I have more time.

It was a lovely hotel in a great location. With the 25 resort fee you also have access to bikes. The restaurant staff were just ok. For some reason it took forever to get a menu if you were not seated my the hostess. If you come from the pool you would not go thru the front entrance. Another oddity was the bar staff at the pool bar charged different prices for drinks. One day my margarita was 14 the next day it was 20. The front dress was great at resolving any issues. Loved that our beach access and chairs came At no extra cost. And young doorman Fabio was by far our favourite staff member. Location on Collins was perfect. We walked everywhere. Restaurant and bar staff should be better trained.

Take a trip on the nautilus to another world. Hotel had a fabulous location and a great energy. All of the staff particularly around the pool could not have been more friendly. Not much Would have to be really picky to find fault here.

Great Location OK Hotel. We spent 4 days at the Nautilus for a quick getaway. The lobby was beautiful and our room was ready at 10AM. it was great we could start our day without waiting until the 3PM check in time. The rooms were nicely decorated and had the Miami vibe. If you are looking for a room with a view make sure you upgrade. The standard room gave us a view of another buildings air conditioning unit no balcony. We did have an issue with our AC not working. When we called for help the service men came to our room very quickly but the problem still was not fixed. Tough sleeping in that Miami humidity with no relief. If you are looking for a quiet hotel while sleeping this is not the place for you. You can hear everyone around you including the people above your room. We were on the 4th floor. The pool area is beautiful and so was the beach with crystal blue water. Every day we would head to the beach around 2PM and there were no towels or change available if you wanted to rent an umbrella. Highly disappointing considering you are charged a daily resort fee and you can not even get a towel on the beach. The excuse was they were waiting for the truck to come in. Location was great and close walking distance to Lincoln Rd for shopping and Ocean Drive for music drinks and food. Finally the staff at this hotel was very attentive and helpful. They work very hard in the blistering heat all day long to make your stay enjoyable. Overall a nice trip but will not be back.
Nice hotel at a good price. Location is good the hotel is close to the beach and to the main attractions in South beach. The room was dark as no view to the pool or to the sea.

Just came back yesterday. We stayed for 3 days. The hotel is beautiful clean and smells so good. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and nice. Pool is gorgeous and temperature regulated. We will definitely be staying here again when we come back to Miami.

A few misses with check in when they charge you an additional 150 per night for incidentals upon arrival and beach chairs not being ready until 945 am. However the room was beautiful ie walk in closet comfy bed dry rack for swim suits the ultra cool snack bar trunk and all the bath essentials you would need qtips full size hair dryer luxury shampoo conditioner body wash robes etc. We did not need half the beauty products we brought. Pool and staff were excellent drinks were yummy and the free fruit infused water polside was a plus on a scorching Miami afternoon. The music playing be the pool was not too loud just enjoyable and an eclectic mix of Brazilian jazz dance tropical you name it. Very relaxing. Restaurant was a bit overpriced but everything we ate was really fresh and baked at hotel. Blueberry scones and passion fruit donuts are made to order and take a while but so worth itThe hotel itself is immaculate and smells amazing. I tried buying a similar scent in the gift shop but nothing was comparable. Location is perfect for families and couples seeking a low key atmosphere. It is a quick walk to Lincoln Rd shops which get more high end as you walk down. Stay away from Ocean drive if you have children. It was seedy and touristy. I was approached by drug dealers on more than one occasion. Overall we had a wonderful stay and will recommend the Nautilus to anyone wanting an upscale yet unpretentious relaxing getaway.
Great hotel could use some quiet time by the pool. Great location nice rooms helpful staff. Music by the pool was too loud ok if you want to party not if you want to relax.
do not go to Nautilus. We booked through bokingcom and they charged 30 dollars extra day for using the pool. do not go.
Boutique hotel in South beach. Fun place for event in so be. A little dated but staff very acomadating.

Decent hotel but needs mainyainance. I spent few days at the hotel during the thanksgiving event. First the location is nearly perfect Close to Ocean drive and all attractions and still has access to private beach area and has a nice pool. However I would recommend staying at a similarly priced Shore Club next door which has a much better ambience. One of the negatives for me was that it had lots of children and strollers The biggest problem was low quality internet connection slow and flaky. Do n’t expect any work done which requires good Wi Fi. Facilities need some upgrade. One of the elevators was out of service on town days creating lines to the elevator. Another aspect of SobA hotels which is probably unavoidable in Miami is hidden costs. There is a 30 daily room surcharge. Minibar is very expensive eg 6 for a small bottle of water. Stuff can be nice or not depending on the person. Most are very helpful. However I had a problem with a male bartender. They give you Expedia VIP drinking tickets this is all you get. but somehow this ended up on my bill 30 for two cocktails. I ca n’t see how this can be a mistake since o just gave the bartender the ticket and did n’t sign the bill.

Pleasant. but there are many options avail at lower prices. Liked the location and the contemporary decor. Did not use ghd facilities as there was so much to do in Miami. Quiet expensive for what you get.

I expected more from this property. Location was amazing. Athmosphere has good potential. Pool would have been beautiful if it was in working condition. Access to beach was fantastic. Pool was broken and filthy. Guests were rude and noisy. Hotel front desk was understaffed. However when I complained they did give me 100 off my bill.
It was memorable. Breakfast and the bars. Breakfast too expensive and staff too distsnt.

Pleasant. Comfortable Bed Nice Pool Service Staff Beach Staff Free Coffee at the room. Overall pretty dirty rooms for the money no Umbrella included at the beach 19 AC loud construction next building I asked for it in advance and they said nothing going on.
nice hotel with all the comfort pool massage restaurant beach with dedicate area. room comfortable but too small bathroom very small. practically on the beach. very expansive the rate.

The location was great and the rooms were clean however the service left a lot to be desired. Housekeeping came by at 930 am every day. even when we were checking out at 11 am. And if you had your Do Not Disturb sign on do not expect to get your room cleaned later without asking mulitple times. Additionally the front desk staff seemed constantly overwhelmed. Unable to answer simple questions about their own events or respond to simple requests without multiple reminders.
